other_tests.findings: Presence of severe right spinal accessory nerve injury with ongoing denervation of the trapezius muscle.
Eliminated scapular winging and significantly improved pain and function scores postoperatively.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At 30 months post-surgery, scapular winging was eliminated, pain was negligible, and subacromial crepitation was greatly reduced; however, a high-riding humeral head remained.

other_tests.findings: Moderate arthritic changes at the superior aspect of the glenohumeral joint and a high-riding humeral head.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Persistence of the humeral head elevation observed at the final follow-up at 26 months post-surgery.
